title: ​​​Check twice, submit once​
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== Page Image ​​​Check twice, submit once​ Get it right the first time for a faster visa process. Page Content ​​ ​​​​​ Applying for a visitor visa Get here sooner, not later. Applying for a student visa Don't miss your deadline. Applying for a skilled visa New opportunities await. Applying for a family visa Join your family sooner than expected. ​​ Get your visa application right the first time If you want to get to Australia sooner, make sure you have all the information and documents we need when you apply. You will get a faster outcome, so make sure you check your application twice before you submit it. Tips for submitting a ‘decision ready’ visa application Check that you have given us all required documents and correct information when you apply. Have all non-English documents translated into English. If you are in Australia you need to include the translator’s National Accreditation Authority of Translators and Interpreters (NAATI) practitioner number. If you are outside of Australia you need to include the translator’s full name, address, phone number and qualifications in the language they are translating. For more information visit NAATI Check you have spelt your name correctly and that it matches the passport you are using to apply for a visa. Check for autocorrect and be sure to list all names you have been known by. If you are under 18 you need to submit a copy of your passport, birth certificate and each of your parents’ passports. Get your police certificates before you apply. We accept police certificates issued in the 12 months before you apply for your visa. For most visa applications, you need to have a health check. You may be able to get your health check before you apply using the My Health Declarations Service. You can access the My Health Declarations service through Check when to have health examinations. Check your ImmiAccount inbox regularly for updates and requests for more information. Respond quickly if we ask for information. If we have to wait for information it will delay processing. If you do not have what we need, let us know and explain why. Get your biometric data collected quickly once we request it from you. ​​Submit your application well ahead of when you want to travel. We suggest you book your flight after we grant your visa. For more information on what to submit with your visa application follow these steps: Visit Department of Home Affairs Enter the visa subclass you are applying for into the search bar. A visa subclass is the number that sits alongside the visa. For example, Visitor (subclass 600). Select the web page of your chosen visa subclass. Click the ‘step by step’ tab. Navigate to ‘gather your documents’, click ‘show steps’ and click through the ‘see how’ options. ImmiAccount – your gateway to an Australian visa You must apply online for most Australian visas through ImmiAccount. When you are setting up your ImmiAccount, make sure that you choose to receive electronic communication from us. This includes updates about your application. Learn how to create an ImmiAccount or login. You can use ImmiAccount to: track the progress of your application see requests for more information add more information or documents to your application update your contact details. ​​​​

===== main placeholder ==========================================
Page Image

# ​​​Check twice, submit once​

​​​Check twice, submit once​

Get it right the first time for a faster visa process.

Get it right the first time for a faster visa process.
Page Content
​​ ​​​​​

### Applying for a visitor visa

Applying for a visitor visa
Get here sooner, not later.

### Applying for a student visa

Applying for a student visa
Don't miss your deadline.

### Applying for a skilled visa

Applying for a skilled visa
New opportunities await.

### Applying for a family visa

Applying for a family visa
Join your family sooner than expected.
​​

## Get your visa application right the first time

Get your visa application right the first time

If you want to get to Australia sooner, make sure you have all the information and documents we need when you apply. You will get a faster outcome, so make sure you check your application twice before you submit it.

If you want to get to Australia sooner, make sure you have all the information and documents we need when you apply. You will get a faster outcome, so make sure you check your application twice before you submit it.

Tips for submitting a ‘decision ready’ visa application

Tips for submitting a ‘decision ready’ visa application
- Check that you have given us all required documents and correct information when you apply.
Check that you have given us all required documents and correct information when you apply.
- Have all non-English documents translated into English. If you are in Australia you need to include the translator’s National Accreditation Authority of Translators and Interpreters (NAATI) practitioner number. If you are outside of Australia you need to include the translator’s full name, address, phone number and qualifications in the language they are translating. For more information visitNAATI.
Have all non-English documents translated into English. If you are in Australia you need to include the translator’s National Accreditation Authority of Translators and Interpreters (NAATI) practitioner number. If you are outside of Australia you need to include the translator’s full name, address, phone number and qualifications in the language they are translating. For more information visit
NAATI
.
- Check you have spelt your name correctly and that it matches the passport you are using to apply for a visa. Check for autocorrect and be sure to list all names you have been known by.
Check you have spelt your name correctly and that it matches the passport you are using to apply for a visa. Check for autocorrect and be sure to list all names you have been known by.
- If you are under 18 you need to submit a copy of your passport, birth certificate and each of your parents’ passports.
If you are under 18 you need to submit a copy of your passport, birth certificate and each of your parents’ passports.
- Get your police certificates before you apply. We accept police certificates issued in the 12 months before you apply for your visa.
Get your police certificates before you apply. We accept police certificates issued in the 12 months before you apply for your visa.
- For most visa applications, you need to have a health check. You may be able to get your health check before you apply using the My Health Declarations Service. You can access the My Health Declarations service through Checkwhen to have health examinations.
For most visa applications, you need to have a health check. You may be able to get your health check before you apply using the My Health Declarations Service. You can access the My Health Declarations service through Check
when to have health examinations.
- Check your ImmiAccount inbox regularly for updates and requests for more information.
Check your ImmiAccount inbox regularly for updates and requests for more information.
- Respond quickly if we ask for information. If we have to wait for information it will delay processing. If you do not have what we need, let us know and explain why.
Respond quickly if we ask for information. If we have to wait for information it will delay processing. If you do not have what we need, let us know and explain why.
- Get yourbiometric datacollected quickly once we request it from you.
Get your
biometric data
collected quickly once we request it from you.
- ​​Submit your application well ahead of when you want to travel. We suggest you book your flight after we grant your visa.
​​Submit your application well ahead of when you want to travel. We suggest you book your flight after we grant your visa.

For more information on what to submit with your visa application follow these steps:

For more information on what to submit with your visa application follow these steps:
- VisitDepartment of Home Affairs.
Visit
Department of Home Affairs
.
- Enter the visa subclass you are applying for into the search bar. A visa subclass is the number that sits alongside the visa. For example, Visitor (subclass 600).
Enter the visa subclass you are applying for into the search bar. A visa subclass is the number that sits alongside the visa. For example, Visitor (subclass 600).
- Select the web page of your chosen visa subclass.
Select the web page of your chosen visa subclass.
- Click the ‘step by step’ tab.
Click the ‘step by step’ tab.
- Navigate to ‘gather your documents’, click ‘show steps’ and click through the ‘see how’ options.
Navigate to ‘gather your documents’, click ‘show steps’ and click through the ‘see how’ options.
​

## ImmiAccount – your gateway to an Australian visa

ImmiAccount – your gateway to an Australian visa

You must apply online for most Australian visas through ImmiAccount. When you are setting up your ImmiAccount, make sure that you choose to receive electronic communication from us. This includes updates about your application. Learn how tocreate an ImmiAccountorlogin.

You must apply online for most Australian visas through ImmiAccount. When you are setting up your ImmiAccount, make sure that you choose to receive electronic communication from us. This includes updates about your application. Learn how to
create an ImmiAccount
or
login.

You can use ImmiAccount to:

You can use ImmiAccount to:
- track the progress of your application
track the progress of your application
- see requests for more information
see requests for more information
- add more information or documents to your application
add more information or documents to your application
- update your contact details.
update your contact details.
